thread.title: Best photos from Atlanta Camping World Truck Series race
thread.title_full: Best photos from Atlanta Camping World Truck Series race

title: Best photos from Atlanta Camping World Truck Series race
text:
Mar 4, 2017 at 7:51p ET 0Shares 
It didn't take long for the   drivers to mix it up Saturday, as the No. 18 of Noah Gragson wrecked on Lap 2 with the No. 7 of Brett Moffitt. 
Christopher Bell went on to win the race. Check out the best photos from the event: Damage done 
Moffitt brings his damaged truck to pit road. Shanna Lockwood Shanna Lockwood-USA TODAY Sports Tough finish 
Kyle Busch, driver of the No. 51 Toyota, led 25 laps but suffered a tough break when a right-front tire went down on a restart with 16 laps to go. He hit the outside wall and ended up 26th. Shanna Lockwood Shanna Lockwood-USA TODAY Sports Great day 
The winning pit crew for driver Christopher Bell goes to work on his No. 4 Kyle Busch Motorsports Toyota. Shanna Lockwood Shanna Lockwood-USA TODAY Sports Leading the way 
Bell leads Matt Crafton and the No. 27 truck of Ben Rhodes, who finished fourth. Crafton finished second. Shanna Lockwood Shanna Lockwood-USA TODAY Sports Out front all day 
Bell led a race-high 99 laps in the 130-lap event. Here, he's out in front of the No. 19 of Austin Cindric. Shanna Lockwood Shanna Lockwood-USA TODAY Sports Wild ride 
The No. 12 of Jordan Anderson brought out the caution after flying through the infield grass with six to go. Runner-up 
Crafton, a two-time series champion, battled door-to-door with Bell through the first two turns on the final restart with three laps to go. Shanna Lockwood Shanna Lockwood-USA TODAY Sports Bell's burnout 
Bell celebrates his third career series win with a burnout. Shanna Lockwood Shanna Lockwood-USA TODAY Sports Happy winner 
Bell celebrates in Victory Lane with the winning trophy. Shanna Lockwood Shanna Lockwood-USA TODAY Sports
